item.name: Customers
item.description:
### Any and All Endpoint Requests for Customers.

Customers are associated with CustomerAccounts, Vehicles, ServiceTickets, and Invoices.

A Mechanic would need to be logged in to view any Customer data.

A Customer would need to be logged in to update or delete their data

**These endpoints have a URL prefixed with:**

`/customers`

item.name: CustomerAccounts
item.description:
### Any and All Endpoint Requests for CustomerAccounts.

CustomerAccounts are associated with Customers.

A Customer would need to be logged in to view their account, update, or delete them.

A Mechanic would need to be logged in to view All CustomerAccounts.

All passwords are hashed as well. Ensuring proper security protocols are in place to keep account data safe.

**These endpoints have a URL prefixed with:**

`/customers/accounts`

item.name: Vehicles
item.description:
### Any and All Endpoint Requests for Vehicles.

Vehicles are associated with Customers and need to be added to the database in order to do any service on them.

**These endpoints have a URL prefixed with:**

`/customers/vehicles`

item.name: ServiceTickets

response.name: Jane's ServiceTicket
Duplicate Ticket
After Mechanic Ticket

item.description:
### Any and All Endpoint Requests for ServiceTickets.

ServiceTickets are associated with Customers, Vehicles, MechanicTickets, and Invoices.

A Mechanic would need to be logged in to view, update, or delete any ServiceTicket.

**These endpoints have a URL prefixed with:**

`/customers/tickets`

item.name: Invoices

response.name: Service Ticket 1 w/o Paid

item.description:
### Any and All Endpoint Requests for Invoices.

Invoices are associated with Customers, and ServiceTickets.

A Mechanic would need to be logged in to create one and are added to the database when the Mechanic has finished working on a ServiceTicket.

**These endpoints have a URL prefixed with:**

`/customers/tickets/invoices`

item.description:
### Any and All Endpoint Requests for Mechanics.

Mechanics are associated with MechanicAccounts, and MechaniTickets.

A Mechanic would need to be logged in to update or delete their own data.

**These endpoints have a URL prefixed with:**

`/mechanics`

item.name: MechanicAccounts
item.description:
### Any and All Endpoint Requests for MechanicAccounts.

MechanicAccounts are associated with Mechanics.

A Mechanic would need to be logged in to view their account, update, or delete them.

A Mechanic would need to be logged in to view All MechanicAccounts.

All passwords are hashed as well. Ensuring proper security protocols are in place to keep account data safe.

**These endpoints have a URL prefixed with:**

`/mechanics/accounts`

item.name: MechanicTickets

response.name: Addtl Unnecessary Fields
After Fields Update
After Service Completion
Removing Washer Fluid

item.description:
### Any and All Endpoint Requests for MechanicTickets.

MechanicTickets are associated with Mechanics, Services, ServiceItems, and ServiceTickets.

A Mechanic would need to be logged in to create one and are added to the database when the Mechanic starts working on a ServiceTicket.

**These endpoints have a URL prefixed with:**

`/mechanics/tickets`

item.name: Inventory

response.name: Duplicate MechanicTickets
Fixed Duplication

item.description:
### Any and All Endpoint Requests for Inventory.

Inventory is associated with ServiceItems, and Services.

A Mechanic would need to be logged in to create one and need to be added to the database to associate them with ServiceItems or Services.

**These endpoints have a URL prefixed with:**

`/inventory`

item.name: ServiceItems

response.name: All ServiceItems

item.description:
### Any and All Endpoint Requests for ServiceItems.

ServiceItems are associated with Services and/or MechanicTickets.

They need to be added to the database in order to include quantity with them.

**These endpoints have a URL prefixed with:**

`/inventory/items`

item.name: Services

response.name: After Schema Adjustments

item.description:
### Any and All Endpoint Requests for Services.

Services are operations that can be done on Vehicles.

They are typically associated with ServiceItems and have their own prices (which do not include the price for ServiceItems).

**These endpoints have a URL prefixed with:**

`/services`
